page.title: 09LEEDSTOWN CRICKET CLUB
page.content: Leedstown Cricket Club was founded in 1873 and after moving fields adjacent to the village (at one time the area where Milbank Meadow is now,was the village cricket field) moved to its present field in 1929. Originally a much smaller building served as a pavilion and was sited immediately to the left of the gate. However in 1931 the Lady Gwen mine closed down and the present pavilion was purchased from the mining company for the sum of Â£150.This sum included transportation. Over the years Leedstown C.C.has produced a playing surface that is the envy of many clubs and always appreciated by visiting teams.The club fields sides that play in Senior Division 2 (west) and Junior Division 3 (west) as well as the Mining Division Evening League.
